title: Cobra 1 1
description:
Ã‚Â°         Ã‚Â°             Ã‚Â°
 ÃƒÅ¡Ãƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€ž Ã‚Â±Ã‚Â² Ãƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€ž Ã‚Â±Ã‚Â² Ãƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€ž Ã‚Â±Ã‚Â² Ãƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃ‚Â¿
 Ã‚Â³X           Ã‚Â°Ãƒâ€ºÃƒÅ¸ÃƒÅ“ÃƒÅ“  Ã‚Â°Ãƒâ€ºÃƒÅ¸ÃƒÅ¸ ÃƒÅ“Ãƒâ€ºÃƒÅ¸ÃƒÅ¸ Ã‚Â²Ãƒâ€ºÃƒÅ¸   ÃƒÅ¸ÃƒÅ¸ÃƒÅ“ Ã‚Â²Ãƒâ€º  Ã‚Â°ÃƒÅ“ÃƒÅ¸Ãƒâ€º Ã‚Â°ÃƒÅ“ Ãƒâ€º Ã‚Â²Ãƒâ€ºÃƒÅ¸Ãƒâ€º Ã‚Â°Ãƒâ€ºÃƒÅ¸ÃƒÅ¸           XÃ‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³            Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º Ãƒâ€º Ãƒâ€º Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€ºÃƒÅ¸  Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º Ãƒâ€º Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º   Ã‚Â²Ãƒâ€ºÃƒÅ¸Ãƒâ€º Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º  Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º ÃƒÅ“ Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º Ãƒâ€º Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º Ãƒâ€º Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€ºÃƒÅ¸             Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    Ã‚Â° Ã‚Â± Ã‚Â² Ãƒâ€º Ã‚Â²Ãƒâ€º Ã‚Â² Ãƒâ€º ÃƒÅ¸Ãƒâ€ºÃ‚Â²Ãƒâ€º Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º Ã‚Â² ÃƒÅ¸Ãƒâ€ºÃ‚Â²Ã‚Â± ÃƒÅ¸Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€ºÃ‚Â² ÃƒÅ¸Ãƒâ€ºÃƒÅ“ ÃƒÅ¸Ãƒâ€ºÃ‚Â²Ãƒâ€º ÃƒÅ¸Ãƒâ€ºÃ‚Â²Ãƒâ€º Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€ºÃ‚Â²ÃƒÅ¸ ÃƒÅ¸Ãƒâ€ºÃ‚Â²Ãƒâ€º Ãƒâ€º Ã‚Â² Ã‚Â± Ã‚Â°    Ã‚Â³
 ÃƒÆ’Ãƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃ‚Â´
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                        - COBRA FOR VIPER GC V1.1 -                       Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                            14th of april, 2005                           Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  WHAT'S NEW ?                                                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - Built-in Audio Fix, that could be Enabled/Disabled in the Config      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    Menu for full backward compatibility with your old backups.           Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - Music Player in Disc Explorer! Select an audio file to play it. For   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    now only ADPCM audio streams are supported (*.ADP, *.PCM, *stream*,   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    etc.), the GC streaming format. Support for more formats, including   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    MP3, is coming in a next release.                                     Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - Optimal DRE Handling, read more below.                                Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - Improved Direct Boot mode Compatibility, now it should be compatible  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    with every good media, including DVD+R.                               Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - No need to enter Disc Explorer anymore to boot MultiBoot discs, just  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    select Direct Boot Disc and the Cobra BIOS will detect automatically  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    if you inserted a GC Original, DVD-R, DVD+R or MultiBoot Disc !       Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - Fixed a MultiBoot compatibility problem. Now it should work properly  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    with every images.                                                    Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - Upgrade with the Disc Explorer from Cobra 1.0 if you want to keep     Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    your AR codes and configuration intact.                               Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - And some more bugfixes/changes                                        Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  About Disc Read Error handling, we can't help you if you use a bad      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  burner, media or if your laser is not tweaked correctly. But we've      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  improved the error handling code A LOT. Here is a small experiment      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  we don't recommend trying at home, except if you know what youre doing: Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  You can remove the spinning disc for one second while it's playing a    Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  movie or loading data. This will trigger some serious read error with   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  any other BIOS :-) Now put the disc back in quickly and it will         Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  continue loading, without a crash!                                      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  FEATURES                                                                Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - Direct boot of all media, without swapping!                           Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - Automatic Media Detection: Insert disc, turn on GC and play!          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - Supports all regions PAL / USA / JAP                                  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - Play originals or backups from any region, thanks to the built-in     Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    region-free feature                                                   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - Built-in Audio Fix, that could be Enabled/Disabled in the Config      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    Menu for full backward compatibility with your old backups.           Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - Idle-bug free (no more Disc Read Errors when the drive is resting :-) Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - Unique MultiBoot feature: put several games on one single disc!       Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - Disc Explorer to browse the content of original GC discs or DVDs and  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    that allows you:                                                      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³      - To flash your Viper GC by burning the flash file on a DVD         Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³      - To execute homebrew programs (.DOL) from DVD, and enjoy many      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³        already-released homebrew productions!                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³      - To play music, for now only ADPCM files aligned on a 32kb         Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³        boundary are accepted. This is the format of all GC games that    Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³        are using audio streaming, so listen to those games songs!        Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³      - To run the game you want from a MultiBoot compilation             Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³      - To load cheat codes from disc into Viper GC Memory                Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - Powerful Cheat Code System compatible with Action Replay codes,       Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    codes are stored in the Viper GC Flash so no memory card is needed!   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - Cheat codes can be either entered using Cobra Menus or loaded from    Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    a file using the Disc Explorer                                        Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - BIOS Configuration stored into the Viper GC Flash                     Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - Selectable default boot action (Main menu, Boot disc, Original BIOS,  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    Disc Explorer) and special boot action (when the X key is held)       Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - Calls Original BIOS Game Loader for 100% compatibility                Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - Supports all hardware revisions (including DOL-101 units)             Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - User-Friendly GUI                                                     Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  A Swap disc option was left in (called &quot;Change Disc&quot; as you could also  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  replace a backup with another backup) to be totally backward            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  compatible. Read more below                                             Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  So what do you need exactly ?                                           Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     - A Viper GC chip                                                    Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     - This very flash file                                               Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     - Some Compatible Media and a DVD-burner                             Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  USER MANUAL                                                             Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³   - If you want to use full-size DVD-R you can remove the top of the     Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     console. Team Xtender will be releasing replacement lids compatible  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     with full DVD-R within two week. Best of all, we learned this week   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     that they will be officially Viper GC branded!                       Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³   - Flash the Viper GC with this BIOS then remove the parallel port      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     connector from the programmer. If you prefear you can flash this     Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     BIOS from DVD if you have Cobra 0.3+ already running on your chip.   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     We've heard Viper Team will release an USB programmer for the chip   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     soon if you prefear USB.                                             Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³   - Turn on your GC with the disc you want to run. It can be an          Ã‚Â³ 
 Ã‚Â³     original or a backup, but if it's a backup it should be filled with  Ã‚Â³ 
 Ã‚Â³     1.3GB of data at least (for now). If you have a black screen coming, Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     it's probably beause your Viper installation is not clean.           Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³   - While turning on your GC:                                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³        - Hold Y to go to Main Menu (if it's not your Default Boot mode)  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³        - Hold X for the other boot mode (can be set in Config Menu)      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³        - Don't hold anything for Default Boot Action                     Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³   - Select &quot;Direct Disc Boot&quot; if you want to play a backup or homebrew   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     program from DVD. If you have problems using the Direct Disc Boot    Ã‚Â³ 
 Ã‚Â³     method with your media, you can still use the Swap trick.            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³   - If you want to use the old Swap Trick Method (for discs that are     Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     not full or that have problems to sync with the Direct Disc Boot)    Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     boot your GC with an original disc. Then choose the &quot;Change Disc&quot;    Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     option and follow the instructions. After the swap is done, you      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     can select Direct Disc Boot option again.                            Ã‚Â³ 
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³   - Select &quot;Original BIOS&quot; if you want to play an original Game          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     compatible with your GC region, or if you want to go into the        Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     Original BIOS menus.                                                 Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³   - Select &quot;Configuration Menu&quot; if you want to change your Cobra BIOS    Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     configuration. The options are quite self-explanatory.               Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³   - Select &quot;Disc Explorer&quot; to enter to browse the content or your        Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     original GC discs or DVDs. Supported file systems are FST            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     (GC File System) and ISO9660. Joliet encoding is not supported in    Ã‚Â³ 
 Ã‚Â³     ISO mode.                                                            Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³   - Enter &quot;Cheat codes&quot; to select, enable, disable and edit cheat codes  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³   - Enter &quot;Disc Explorer&quot; and select a .VGC file if you want to reflash  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     your Viper GC without the need of the Parallel port programmer!      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³   - Enter &quot;Disc Explorer&quot; and select a .DOL file if you want to run      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     a homebrew program! (You can put up to 1.4 GB of homebrew things on  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     a disc. We hope this will give some inspiration to emu authors :-)   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     Our DOL loader is not perfect for now and works for around half of   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     the public homebrew programs. Here are some of the programs booting  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     successfully:                                                        Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     GC-Linux, Ascii Fighter, DVD Browser, CTR_GCS, CTR_SND, GBQ Gameboy  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     emulator, PSOLoader &quot;It's working&quot; demo, Maze, Nitrorally,  Yeti 3D  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     3D engine, Chip8 emulator, Snowlords game, Terranigma, XRick and     Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     probably many we missed!                                             Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³   - Enter &quot;Disc Explorer&quot; and select a .VGC file if you want to reflash  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     your Viper GC without the need of the Parallel port programmer!      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³   - Enter &quot;Disc Explorer&quot; and select a .COD file if you want to add      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     cheat codes for a game without the need to enter it using the pad!   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³   - Make sure that the &quot;lid passthru&quot; wires of the Viper GC are          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     installed correctly or the disc won't spin.                          Ã‚Â³ 
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  DIRECT BOOT LIMITATIONS                                                 Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  THE MEDIA                                                               Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  The GC drive in its default state only eats high-quality DVD-R and      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  a few MINI-DVD-R. But a couple of weeks ago, speedi from the afterdawn  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  forums found a nice way to tweak the laser so it reads almost any burnedÃ‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  media including some DVD+Rs. We recommend doing this laser tweak if you Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  have any problems reading your DVDs. We are no laser experts, in fact   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  we think it would be more appropriate to just lower the value of the    Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  variable resistor instead of setting it to an absoulte given value,     Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  but lots of people including us have been using this laser tweek for a  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  couple of weeks without any problem reported so far. For more info on   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  laser tweaking please read this forum post:                             Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³     http://forums.afterdawn.com/thread_view.cfm/138930                   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  You don't need to encrypt the disc or use a special burner firmware     Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  to write the disc. Just burn your ISO/GCM (rename it to .ISO) with      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  Nero (or any other tool).                                               Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  CHEAT CODES                                                             Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  If you want to use cheat codes, enter Cheat Codes menu,select a game,   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  check the codes you want to use, exit the cheat selector and enable     Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  cheats.                                                                 Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  To add new codes follow on-screen instructions. The codes are           Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  compatible with decrypted AR codes. You can decrypt AR codes using      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  the great GCNCrypt by Parayste. Never enter the first code of a given   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  cheat code (validator code). You can also put .COD files on a DVD and   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  load cheat codes from there, each file corresponds to one game.         Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  Cheat codes are working for backups and original games.                 Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  For now we've reserved 4kb in Viper GC Flash memory to store cheat      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  codes, that should be enough to store a few hundred of codes.           Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  TROOBLESHOOTING                                                         Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - If the disc stops spinning in the menu it means that the drive can't  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    sync with your media, or that there are not enough data on your disc. Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    In direct boot mode the GC is very selective about the media it       Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    takes. If you have any problem please try the swap trick. If you      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    still have problems try with different media/burner. Make sure your   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    laser is correctly tweaked! We strongly recommend NEC burners, they   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    produce really good discs that won't give you any DRE.                Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - Audio Streaming: Some games use a special audio streaming mode        Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    that can be compared to CDDA. For now, the ISO of the file needs to   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    be patched with 0rbital's great ViperTemporaryAudioFix 1.1+. If the   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    ISO is not patched you'll have noise instead of music. We will try to Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    fix this issue so no patching is required. But in case we do, YOUR    Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    PATCHED ISOS WILL BE FULLY COMPATIBLE and still work with music!      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    (so forget what is written in the fixer nfo file). Don't run the fix  Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    on ISOs that don't need fixing as it will only destroy them :-)       Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  - Most multi-discs games are working, just play with Disc 1 until       Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    you're asked to change disc and make a save here. Then boot with      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    Disc 2 instead. We started working on code to allow disc-change,      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³    and we'll integrate it in a new release.                              Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  All those problems could be fixed in a next update.                     Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  Before burning an image, makes sure it is 1459978240 bytes long else    Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  you may need to use the swap trick method.                              Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  To know what's your GC Version code (2 digit number) go into Config     Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  Menu, then Version Info, 2nd page. First digit corresponds to GC        Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  mobo version, 2nd digit corresponds to drive version.                   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  IF YOU MAKE BACKUPS, DON'T USE ANY &quot;WIPE&quot; TOOLS TO SAVE SPACE. Unless   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  you know it's REALLY working. Most of thoses tools only work because    Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  the current pso loaders patch libraries routines to emulate DVD. But    Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  on REAL HARDWARE, each file/fst has to be aligned on a 4-byte boundary! Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  Else nothing will work. Audio Files (for audio streaming) even need     Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  to be aligned on a 32kb-boundary ! So forget current &quot;WIPE&quot; tools until Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  they are fixed. But note that Garbage is NOT NEEDED by the GC. The      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  files must be correctly aligned that's it. So if your &quot;WIPE&quot; tool is    Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  not changing the image size (meaning there's no relocation) then it's   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  probably fine. Use FSTFIX by LOONYCUBE to fix bad rips.                 Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  TECHNICAL INFO                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  We'll release a command-line MultiBoot Disc maker next week if nobody   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  releases a better one before we do :-) Here are the specs for Multiboot Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  discs. Note that every image should be aligned on a 32kb boundary.      Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  At offset 0x00: 43 4F 42 52-41 4D 42 31                                 Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³            0x40: Position of the 1st image in bytes (Big endian)         Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³            0x44: Position of the 2nd image in bytes (Big endian)         Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³            ....: ...etc...                                               Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³            ....: 00 00 00 00                                             Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  The MultiBoot feature is stealth for the GC so it's 100% compatible     Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  with homebrew images. If you want to put several backups on one disc    Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  you'll have to remove the garbage at first.                             Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  The maximum size of a MultiBoot disc is 1459978240 bytes.               Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  You can use Viper_Multi_Boot_ISO_Creator by LoonyCube to create         Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  MultiBoot discs easily.                                                 Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  THE FUTURE                                                              Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³  Much more to come :-)                                                   Ã‚Â³
 Ã‚Â³                                                                          Ã‚Â³
